alert.note: Alert for Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 4:26PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Coconino County near Page, Arizona through 500 PM MST/600 PM MDT/... At 424 PM MST/524 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marble Canyon, or 12 miles southwest of Page, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Page, Big Five, LeChee, Marble Canyon, Lees Ferry, Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Antelope Creek Basin, Wahweap, Lake Powell, Antelope Canyon and Waterholes Canyon. This includes the following highways... State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 527 and 556. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 526 and 545. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
